title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: The Home Affairs Minister is concerned a court may overturn his ban on an asylum seeker coming to Australia under the medevac legislation. A 21-year old Iranian woman is preparing to travel from Nauru for medical treatment, but Peter Dutton has rejected her request to travel with her father. Mr Dutton tabled documents to parliament - claiming the man has a history of violent behaviour, and involvement in running a prostitution ring. Mr Dutton said about 40 people who have come to Australia under the medevac legislation are refusing medical treatment. Image: AP
